Reviews.Title: “Elegant Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: LadyDragonHumboldt
Reviews.Content: I would call The Tropicana "shabby chic". Slightly worn around the edges but, clean and full of character. The suite was comfy, very clean and I couldn't hear the neighbors at all. The kitchen was impeccably clean and supplied with dishes and cookware, all in clean working order. I could walk in my socks on the rug and they stayed clean (a clean room test for me). The price is right for downtown Vancouver. Great restaurants and shopping within walking distance, free off street parking and attentive staff. The lower floors seem to be permanent residents, we met a few and they were very cordial and helpful. Never saw any sign on "children tearing through the lobby" or "surly" staff of any kind. We will definitly be back the next time we travel to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Working hard to keep your business”
Reviews.Author: bouncey
Reviews.Content: This all suite hotel is a mix of residents and guests. We were delighted to find a clean apartment with a wonderful staff who were very helpful. If you are looking for a multi-cultural experience in a multi-cultural city, this is your place. If you are a Holiday Inn type with prefab breakfast of junk food, you may want to look elsewhere. Rooms were recently renovated with a complete apartment (including pots and pans) There are many great dining and shopping opportunities nearby or hop on one of the many tour busses available.Robson St is the fashion area of Vancouver so it's all available for you! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't. Just don't.”
Reviews.Author: Crystal1177
Reviews.Content: After a recommendation from a our group made a reservation at this hotel when we were traveling to Vancouver on business and added a personal day on to our trip. We knew that we were staying at a budget hotel but this was so "low-rent" that you couldn't pay me to stay there. The first impression was so deplorable we didn't even check into our room. Upon entering the lobby you are greeted by an odour that can only be described as the great unwashed doused in cheap perfume. Children (elementary school age) tearing through the lobby. We were "greeted" by a surly front desk agent in a faded ratty tshirt. Our reservation was incorrect. We had booked for 4 girls to stay in one room and had been told we would have 2 Queens & a pullout when making the reservation. We were told what was a available was a room with one double and a pull out,that Queens didnt even exist and they were sold out. We then pointed out their website details including the information of bed type - Queens exist). We stepped aside to talk about what we were going to do. It was at this point we opted to check Expedia for alternate accomadation. When he realized what we were doing he YELLED at us to "just leave then". Done! I cannot comment on rooms, ammenities or anything else other then to say that perhaps they rent their rooms by the hour.

Reviews.Title: “There is a difference between humble and filthy. This hotel is filthy.”
Reviews.Author: radgirl3
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not appear to have had any updating since the 1970's. It might have been a three star when first opened, but is a zero star now. Filthy carpets, holes in the walls, holes in the sheets, no doors on the closets, rock hard mattresses, threadbare towels. Intense and nauseating smell of smoke. We had to sleep with the windows open in mid winter because of the stench. Internet and fan in bathroom didn't work, nor did many of the electrical sockets. Large chunk of the toilet was missing. Fire alarms and smoke detectors are wired on the outside of the walls. This was the worst hotel I've ever seen, including some Third World places. Do yourself a favor--no discount rate is worth your self respect.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the fussy... perfect for couples/family with realistic expectations”
Reviews.Author: lisaq42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights at the end of August 2008. It was easy to find on Robson St (despite the road work being done further up Robson). We got a great parking spot right in front of check in and best of all, the parking spot was FREE. Free!!! That's a good value in a fairly expensive city. We were able to check right and get our room key to suite 1001- the first suite on the 10th floor. This faced Robson St which was a blessing and a curse- as I will explain. You enter into a hallway and on the left is a small bathroom and bedroom and to the right, a living room and kitchen. It's a smallish apartment and perfect for 2 people, or a family, for an extended stay. There is a precariously small balcony facing Robson that we barely dared to step out on (it was only about 2 feet deep) but the views were great- you could see all the way to Stanley Park and the mountains beyond. Since it was August, it was warm, about 80 degrees (F) and so we opened every window since there is no A/C, but there was a ceiling fan in the living room. This is where the problem of facing Robson came to play. The location on Robson St is great- lots of bars and restaurants and shopping, etc. But it bustles every night, ALL night. We could hear cars and people until 3 am or later. Busses that stopped across the street were extremely loud and ran very late and then very early and even on the 10th floor, because all the windows were open, we could hear lots of noise all the time. So, the location is the tradeoff, but fair warning. The bedroom had a queen bed and 2 dressers and a clothes bar (not closet) and that was literally it. Very sparsely furnished and shabby, old furnishings at that- but clean. I must emphasize that it was clean. The bathroom was also clean but small, and the towels weren't great but everything worked fine. The bathroom came with dishes, utensils, coffeemaker, a fridge and stove- great! The coffee supplies were refilled every day and the fridge came in handy. The TV got lots of channels so there was always something to watch. This is the kind of place to stay if you want to feel like you are living in a city rather than just a guest in a hotel. We had a decent stay, nothing spectacular. The rooms could do with an overhaul of paint and carpet and furniture for sure. It's not for the fussy or picky but completely fine and functional if you go into it knowing that Vancouver is an expensive city and for $129 (CAD) we got a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gablor
Reviews.Content: Like other previous reviewers we really liked the location. Also Carlos in the lobby was very helpful and nice. However, I guessed the people that stayed in the room before us had cooked fish, and the smell stayed with us for both days. Additionally, be aware that while you get a beautiful view the sliding doors that open to the balcomies can be a little bit scary if you have young kids (we were on the 10th floor). The hotel does not offer the breakfast, so if you are a family of 4 hungry people, that could become an additional expence, but the room has a little kitchen, so you can prepare your own food.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Location and Price!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBrian
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five night stay at the Tropicana in lovely Vancouver. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. Close to everything, no need for taxis. Right on gorgeous Robson Street where you'd normally spend double the price on the fancy hotels. Granted this is just a Motor Hotel, so it's not fancy. If you're fussy, go spend double down the street. But who's in the room for that long?! Every unit has a living room and separate bedroom. The mattress was brand new and very comfortable. The views are incredible, watching the sunset and the action on the street. There is no A/C, but Vancouver doesn't get that hot. This was an odd weekend weather-wise and it was very warm. But we just kept the curtains closed and the breeze drifted through the place. It was just fantastic. The staff are polite, and helpful. There is a pool, however it is in the basement so it's kind of odd. But it's there to cool you down if you're warm, then go back out into the gorgeous city and explore. Parking is in the back for those that drive, and the car will just stay there (safely) as you will not need to drive. This is our third time back to the Tropicana and it won't be the last!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, no A/C but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LavandaUsa_Wa
Reviews.Content: Pros: Unbeatable location, all you need is withing a walking distance. Staff is very friendly and ready to assist . Nice suites: one bedroom and sofa-bed in the living area, kitchen with utensils and fridge. Secured parking. Cons: Desperately in need for renovation and A/C installation. We stayed there for one night, but it was HOT night, since rooms gets very warm over the day, and at night you can not really open the windows because of city noise and luck on screens/sheers on the window.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: MBA52
Reviews.Content: Bed Bugs in Room 705. Stayed here 14-17 August when temperature was around 30C. No Air-Con or fan. I have stayed in third world countries and this was my first experience of bed bugs. Never again - I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HopAustin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location. It's easy to walk along Robson or the short walk to Stanley Park. The parking was okay. The room, while clean, was pretty run down. The carpet was dirty and smelled if we didn't keep the window cracked open. It had dishes, pots, pans, refrigerator and electric stove. You need to bring your own dish detergent as they do not provide it or wash the dishes daily. The door does not have a dead bolt, it does have a latch that keeps the door from opening, but not from being unlocked. All said we would stay there again because of the price and location. It's between a 1 and 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Palakila
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night there with wife and 2 kids and for the price and specially location, it was a good deal. The sofa-bed spring box I slept in with my son had better days so we moved the mattress to the floor, closed the sofa and it was all good. The water was cold at the first shower but got warm right after so if you think you are an early bird and hoping to get that nice shower before the rest of the building wakes up, be aware. We did not use the pool, which was actually in the basement and no window. For breakfast I ran to Starbucks to get some food but the kitchen had a working fridge, stove and utensils. Still the experience was fine and I would stay there again for the price and location. It has parking, which is a big deal around Robson. From there you can walk to most places at night, English Bay, Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “very nice location!”
Reviews.Author: BergenRoy
Reviews.Content: Well, about the room, that was a bit outdated and really need some remodeling, if that said, it really has a excelent location central at robson street and short way to stanley park and all downtown vancouver. The vieuw i got to robson street from the 12th floor was absolutely nice, could spend all evening watching the street and the city life. It had even a small kitchen and had no problems with the water some i read in some of the other revieuws, also the staff was nice and helpfull. Would sure consider it again if i'm in vancouver. But i would ask a high florr, because it can be pretty noisy if you life down in the building i guess.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: jitterbugger
Reviews.Content: The location was very good, within walking distance of Stanley Park, shops, restaurants, marinas and the seabus and public transport in general. The suites were spacious, with separate bedroom and living room. Ours had a pretty good view to two sides and a very small balcony, just for stepping on to for fresh air. There was lots of storage space and the bathroom was clean. The kitchen was very small but probably adequate. We had no reason to use it. The buiding itself looked as though it needed updating, and the carpet in the reception area was being replaced while we were there, so perhaps this is a start! Our only problem was that we had no hot water for 2 days. Interestingly a previous reviewer had the same problem in January this year. Fortunately the weather was warm and we did not need any heating, but we had to boil the kettle to get hot water for washing and the plug in the wash basin did not stay in place, so washing was rather tricky. Unfortunately, no representative from the hotel advised us of the problem, let alone apologized for the situation; we had to ask when the boiler would be repaired. On checking out, we had to ask for a discount for the inconvenience and we did negotiate one, but we did have to ask. The gentleman who agreed this discount explained that boilers could break down at any time and still did not apologize. If I were to return to Vancouver I would still consider this hotel, but I would certainly compare the price with others first, and I certainly wouldn't stay there when I may want some heating. It is just too unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “not the ritz but its a great location”
Reviews.Author: AvaChic
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the Tropicana, I had the feeling that I was at a rundown Las Vegas hotel. The dresser is in the livingroom rather than the bedroom and the stove is ancient. After the initial shock, I realized that I have free wifi, which works most of the time but most importantly, I am in the heart of the West End of Vancouver. I am in walking distance of Stanly Park and a simple bus ride away from Grandville Island. Saving money to me is important and Vancouver is expensive. However, for the price (in Vancouver) I feel it is reasonable. The other hotels are charging their guests $15.00 per day to have wireless internet access. I do feel lucky. It is clean here. There is evidence of previous smokers in this room but I would not have known by the smell. I only see the carpet burns on the floor. At a $100.00 per night, which is cheap in Vancouver, it is decent. Your only other choice is to pay $20.00 per night at the local hostels and share a room with 3 other people; that was no deal for me. I have sleeping issues and prefer privacy if I can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful about booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandyPB
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver in early January 2008. I was originally booked at the Blue Horizon Hotel up the road (at CDN 110 a night) and was extending my stay so wanted a place that was a little cheaper. The Tropicana had availability for about CDN 80 a night and I inspected a suite on the top floor (12th floor). The building is old but the suite was clean enough with a separate bathroom of a decent size (and more importantly no mould lurking in the corners of the bath / shower), the bed seemed comfortable and the kitchen area serviceable. My only gripe was that the TV was in a separate living area (with a couch) and not in the bedroom. I was travelling by myself and did not require a lot of room, however I can see how a more traditional apartment arrangement would benefit couples or families as there was heaps of room and storage. The suite also seemed quite bright. Anyway, I went back the next morning to book this suite but was told that the building had no hot water or heating!!! I asked when this was expected to be fixed and the gentleman at the front desk could not tell me when. I said that I was intending to book the suite for a week but this was probably not a good time to do so and he also agreed. For CDN 40 more a night, I ended up extending my stay at the Blue Horizon (this is a fantastic hotel and was totally worth the extra bucks!) Incidentally, when I was inspecting the suite, there was also a lift technician visiting the building. Apparently one of the two lifts had stopped working. My advice to those wishing to book a place in this hotel is to have something in writing from the management, saying that if the hot water system / heating system etc does not work for more than 10 hours (or whatever your tolerance level is), you have the right to terminate your stay, receive a refund for any accommodation paid upfront or a discount for the remainder of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plenty of space”
Reviews.Author: KuruK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the "buffer zone" between downtown and the West End. Quite a lot is within walking distance -- Stanley Park, downtown (shopping, Art Museum, etc.), Yaletown, Gastown, etc. There are abundant restaurants, bars, etc. within a block or two of the hotel. The area appears to be quite safe. The street (Robson) can be noisy at night, but our hotel room was reasonably quiet for all that. There is free parking, although probably not enough spaces to accomodate everyone when the hotel is full. The front desk was very helpful and friendly, and the room (including the kitchen) was quite clean. The rooms are actually suites, with a bedroom, living room and fully-equipped kitchen. (The hotel looks like it might be a converted apartment building.) The living room window opens onto a narrow balcony. There are reasonably nice views of the city and surrounding mountains. The hotel does show its age. The corridors are rather dark and bleak, the carpets have some old stains, the furniture has some tears in the fabric, etc. The beds, however, were quite nice, with firm mattresses and cozy blankets. The room was the sort of place that was pleasant enough to be in, without holding you back from wanting to head out and explore the city. Keeping in mind that Vancouver is an expensive city, this is a reasonably priced place for its location, and one I'd stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: lenabun
Reviews.Content: Based upon previous reviews in trip advisor, we selected this location. The price was right and so were the accommodations. It was much better than indicated and when next in Vancouver I will return. Though we didn't drive we were amazed at the parking facility. Also the pool and laundromat were added luxuries. WIFI not in rooms YET.. management indicated that will be next improvement. Had to go to lobby to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large suite, dated”
Reviews.Author: fla04
Reviews.Content: Tropicana Suites on Robson is the updated name on the Internet. The in-town location is 1 mile from the cruise ship terminal and GasTown and nearer to Stanley Park and trendy Coal Harbour. The suite size was good but it and, especially the kitchen, are dated. The price was very good for central Vancouver. Air conditioning = opening the windows, but it worked. This was a good place to spend a night before a cruise. The front desk staff were friendly and had a taxi dispatched in minutes. We found a great little restaurant nearby on Robson for breakfast, Roscoe's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KD's Mommy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tropicana after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disapointed. The hotel is in an excellent location on Robson Street in the centre of Downtown and has the added advantage of free car parking (if you can't get in at the side of the hotel, don't worry, there is plenty of room in the underground car park) It is within easy walking distance to Coal Harbour, Canada Place, and historic Gastown, and in the other direction it is a 20 minute walk down Hornby Street to the tiny ferries that go to Granville Island. A short car ride (or you could walk) is Stanley Park. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Try Fog and Suds just a few metres up the street. It has a nice pub atmosphere and serves really good food. We were pleasantly suprised to have a spacious suite on the 11th floor with ceiling to floor windows in both the sitting room and bedroom. The staff were very friendly and efficient and I would recommend the Tropicana as extremely good value for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJamie
Reviews.Content: i was a little worried about staying there because i thought it would be a bit dirty and dingy . it was neither ! it is a little dated but it is very clean and comfortable .the rooms are spacious and perfect for a stay of more than one or two nights. the staff was very friendly and helpful the only drawback was that whenever we had the windows open the pigeons woudl fly into the room ... otherwise it was a great deal for the money

Reviews.Title: “Good views and functional”
Reviews.Author: blindjoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana with my wife, sister, and new baby during a two day stay in Vancouver recently. We found the staff friendly, the room functional, the location excellent and the price quite reasonable. Reception were welcoming and were amenable to a early check in which was good since we had just come off a 20 hour flight. It was also easy to find on Robson near shopping and eating and the parking was free. The rooms are quite worn and dated but they are spotlessly clean. The bathroom is a bit claustrophobic and bit hot and steamy. The bedroom was a reasonable size and the living room and kitchen adequate. The view from the 12th floor was great though. All in all. Good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the money”
Reviews.Author: TheTaco
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a night prior to going to Whistler. The location is great! Stanley Park is near by. It is right on Robson street. Our hotel room had views of both False Creek (in between buildings) and the nightlife on Robson street. The building is worn. The Elevators are small. But the rooms, while dated, are reasonably big. There was a pull-out couch and a seperate bedroom w/ 2 single beds. I think we paid $99 US for a night (so Robson street for about $50 a person). In January the hotel was not very crowded. We were able to park the rental car on-site in the small cramped lot. I drove to the Grouse mountain gondola in 20 minutes. The airport was 20 to 30 minutes away (no Interstate connection). There are much nicer hotels in that area, but if you are on a budget, this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: thriftylisa
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana in Vancouver, BC is in a great location. Walking distance to Stanley Park, Granville and all the shopping on Robson. The hotel is a bit run down - but the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The rooms are very large with separate bedrooms and kitchens. I was traveling with my daughter and we felt very safe in the neighborhood. The service was very good and if you are looking for a bargain hotel - it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in May 06. We had been anxious before arriving having read some alarming reviews. Thankfully, these proved unfounded. We were in a corner room on the 11th floor which gave us fantastic views of both Robson Street and the mountains. The room was a great size and gave us breathing space especially as we were there for 2 weeks. It had a large living area, a small but fairly well equiped kitchen, lobby area and bathroom with overhead shower (bathroom had a hairdryer). Plenty of storage space. The cleaning staff came in every day and will change the towels each day if you want. The pool, in the basement, was clean and we used it most days without any problems. Other facilities included an on site laundry room and sauna. The staff were very helpful. Yes, the building could benefit from upgrading but it was clean and well serviced. It is very well located (2mins from the Landmark Hotel but not at their prices). We got a great deal for our fortnight and more importantly would return again and recommend it to our friends. Classed as 'above average' considering location and price. Ger & Alan, Watford, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive points: 1. great staff, very helpful 2. superb cleaning 3. you can regulate your own heat Now the negatives: 1. hotel has very bad insulation. you can hear someone take a leak three floors up. 2. don't try the pull out couches. you will definitely wake up soar from the spirals in the matrass. 3. quite noisy cause they let in language students who can bring their own stereos, getto blasters etc. there are quite a number of mexican students who all seem to know eachother so on the weekends expect a lot of noise from elevators going up and down, people being wasted and loud knocking on each other's doors. don't be surprised if you hear a door slam 15 times in an hour. 4. rooms with two single beds are located on 3rd and 5th floor only and that is where you find a lot of students as well who put 4 in a room (including pull out couch) 5. part owners have the appearance of having some class but behind the facade they are money grabbers just like a lot of accommodation owners are. 6. we've had one day without heat and hot water but no compensation whatsoever. heat went out again a couple of days later. 7. hotel is a bit of a dump and should be called spring break hotel or student dorm hotel. 8.if you book make sure you ask for a room on the 8th floor and up. 9. stayed there for one month and had to move 4 times due to excessive noise from language students. 10. owners don't care who rents as long as you pay. granted they kicked out 2 people when we were there but one was related to the fact that one person booked and brought in another one later. your daily rate is based on the number of people you make the reservation for. another one got kicked out cause of a massive party in the penthouse. you'd find young people with bottles in the reception area etc. don't say we dind't tell you

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: android
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was simple, and a little run down, but huge. We had a good sized bedroom, with a nice closet. A living room with coffee table, sitting table, couch, and view. Also a kitchen. Having a suite was a nice luxury for a non-luxury price (we paid about $139 Canadian). The management was friendly and helpful. The kitchen was nice for making a pot of tea, and was fully equipped. The location, in the heart of the Robson street area, can't be beat. Close to Stanley Park, restaurants, everything! There is no air conditioning, but this was never a problem, as there was a good breeze. The only downside was road and people noise from below. We were on the 6th floor, but it would be nice to be higher. Oh, free parking!!! Let me say that again....Free Parking!!! This is essential if you have a car, as parking in Vancouver is a nightmare and very expensive. All in all, I'd go back there, especially in the summer where most places are much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pool broken Kitchen broken what a rip off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in and the only room i could get was one with a huge chunk of drywall covering the entrance to the kitchen as it was broken still had to pay full rate of about 150.00 canadian. Stayed there last year @ the same time for 90.00 canadian. Went downstairs to have a swim and relax after a 10 hour drive only to find the pool was also shut down. Figured i'd at least have a nice warm shower only there was not even any warm water. They should build a fence around this hotel and call it a prison. Been going there for years but its quite clear that management is only out for the money and not the customer. I'd rate it at about 2 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “What a dumper!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hmmmmmmmm should have known better but booked this place a few days in advance of a Friday night BC Lions Football game and got a room no problem. This was after phoning a dozen other places that could not accomodate us. Well the old saying "you get what you pay for" holds true with this joint, no wait a minute, the Tropicana actually gives you less. It's a dumper; theres no better description. Stepping off the elevator into a dimily lit narrow corridor with surface mounted conduits on the ceiling said "turn around". Entering the poorly ventilated, sparsely decorated room said"get out quick". This place is shabby, rundown and would be too much money at half the price and it's cheap to begin with. The bathroom door would not close as it had been kicked in and broken, there were no towel bars, and the toilet paper was a half used roll sitting on the toilet tank as there was no paper holder. There was a single miniscule bar of soap and a previously used bottle of shampoo, two tiny bath towels, a single hand towel and nothing else. My wife called housekeeping to ask for face cloths and was informed that they had run out!! The 1960's kitchen was another award winner and made us cringe at the thought of someone actually using the dirty utensils and garage sale smallwares provided. The bedroom was the only redeeming feature and had a clean, comfortable bed so we decided to stick it out for the night and got the heck out of there first thing in the morning. Wish I had taken photos to add to this review because it flys in the face of the other reviews here, but please do yourself a favour and find something better.

Reviews.Title: “It's just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just can say: really nice hotel!!! great price per night, a nice mini suite with kitchen and a perfect view on Robson street and the sea (book at 11th floor!). This is the perfect hotel if you are looking for location in downtown Vancouver for a really good price and if you don't like the motels and hostels. It's not a first class luxury hotel but it's just perfect. I add two pics to the left and to the right side at night from my balcony on 11th floor.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastwonder
Reviews.Content: First before I give you my review, I should probably tell you a bit of my background to let you know whos writing this review. I am a 22 year old male and my girlfriend is 19. We are both students who decided to travel across the west coast. Our travels included Banff, Lake Louise, Kelowna, Vancouver, and North Battleford(haha childhood memories). Feel free to check out my other reviews of hotels we stayed in. Now for the review: First, let me say that this does have a great location on Robson street and the price is very nice. However, this does not make up for a few BIG problems with this hotel! Let me tell you the biggest problem first: NO AIR CONDITIONING!!! When this first came to my attention from the front desk staff I was a tad shoked to hear that a hotel in Vancouver didn't have a common hotel amenity such as air conditioning. Needless to say coming in from +30 degree tempurature our ovenlike hotel suite was less than tolerable. And let me tell you, sleeping was even less tolerable! Another problem we had started after we arrived in the room. Usually after a long trip from Kelowna to Vancouver, one would have to go to the bathroom or have a quick shower to freshen up before a night out on the town. This however was not possible BECAUSE THE WATER DIDN'T WORK!!! Now, we figured this was not such a big deal since we wouldn't be in the room all day anyways really so we just left this small annoyance behind us. One thing we wanted to check out was the pool though(even though we were pretty sure it wasn't running). We were sharing the elevator with two of the "competent" maids(LONGEST wait for an elevator I've ever had...and we were only on the 8th floor) and asked if the pool was open. One of the maids abruptly answered, "No". When we asked if we could just see it we recieved a "No" aswell. The maids were quite rude. The front desk staff was polite but I wouldn't say nice or anything remotely close to hospitable. I could probably go on for a while about how much we hated this hotel but I will say that we didn't end up staying for the rest of the planned 3 nights. Good riddance Tropicana Inn. We might go back to Vancouver but I guarantee you that we will not return to this hotel. So, in conclusion, if your idea of a good hotel is one without air conditioning, rude staff, a small parking lot, no alarm clocks, plain looking decor and much more garbage, then by all means, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal-Would Return”
Reviews.Author: Novaya
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice for our 7 night stay in Vancouver- (Oct2004)-- The location could NOT be beat- it was right on Robson where all the action was- just minutes from restaurants and shopping. We could walk or bus wherever we needed extremely easily. The room was not brand spanking new- but the washroom, and the beds were all very clean. And the sizes or their room were very generous- had a separate bedroom, a kitchenette, sitting room and a good size bathroom with a tub. And the price was extrememly reasonable- just around $110 a night for 3 people which is definitely less than the hotels etc in the same vicinity. There weren't a lot of extra amenities (ie. no breakfast), but there was a small basement pool, elevators, competent maid service, and good views (we had a room facing the back and could see a sliver of water from Stanley park). As with a similar poster, I noticed that a lot of travel books left this little gem out. I'm not sure why, because it's an excellent budget choice for a stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Hotel in Vancouver - Great!”
Reviews.Author: MsCHfromTomatoLand
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesistant about booking a room at the Tropicana Hotel in Vancouver, as most travel guides have left this hotel off their list. Well, they are really missing something. For the money (it was about 20-40 dollars a night cheaper than the neighboring hotels), the room was great. Actually, it was a mini-suite with a kitchen and a seperate bedroom! It was clean, comfortable, and secure. It had a great view of Robson Street, and was right in the heart of the shopping district. The drive to Stanley Park only took 10 minutes, and that was during rush hour traffic! If need be, you could walk to the park, as it is only about a mile away. The hotel provides onsite and overflow parking for no extra charge. There was no room service available, but the place is surrounded by good restaurants, and food delivery is available. With the kitchen, you can even keep your leftovers for the next day! If you like Chinese food, be sure to check out the restaurant on the same side of the street just a few doors down. The food is great, and a very good deal. The waterfront is only several blocks away, too. I highly recommend the Tropicana in Vancouver for those looking for a good deal, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location, exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (four 23 year olds) spent 5 nights here in August 2004. The location was absolutely perfect and the cost was very reasonable. The free parking was an added bonus. The rooms are plain but immaculate, and some have incredible ocean views. Our room had a queen bed in the bedroom, and a pull-out sofa in the living area. The woman at the front desk was kind enough to give us an 11th floor room with a clear view of the fireworks show! I would go back to this place in a heartbeat, and would highly recommend it to most travelers (not to those who are exceptionally picky about decor, or those who can't sleep comfortably on a pull-out sofa).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: campi
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Suites on Robson (formerly the Tropicana Motor Inn) surpassed our expectations. We spent three nights at this hotel in a lovely clean one bedroom suite on the 10th floor with a full kitchen and an outstanding ocean view. We had just returned from an Alaska cruise and their self-service laundry downstairs was appreciated. The hotel is surrounded by outstanding restaurants and is across from the Empire Landmark Hotel, close to Stanley Park and the cruise terminal. The hotel staff was very helpful. We had gated free parking for our rental car and best of all, the cost of three nights was less than one night at most of the hotels in the surrounding area. Highly recommended!!
